texts.definition: Places in game world that contain resources.
markups: <style="Definition">Places in game world that contain resources.</style>
<style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> are simply places in game worlds where resource that are useful to players can be found.

The levels in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pac-Man">Pac-Man</link></style> have specific <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> for the "power pellets". Certain spaces in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Civilization%20(video%20game)%20series">Civilization series</link></style> have valuable resources in them. For the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Europa%20Universalis%20series">Europa Universalis series</link></style>, all provinces have resources but different ones.

The levels in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Doom%20series">Doom</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Half-Life%20series">Half-Life</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tomb%20Raider%20series">Tomb Raider</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Quake%20series">Quake series</link></style> all have places where players can find ammunition, first aid kits, and other items that help players in gameplay challenges.

<style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> are used in games to provide <style="Link"><link="resource-sources">Resource Sources</link></style> in <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>. Which <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> to place and where to place them are the main design choices in focus when using <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style>.

Some games only put <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> in certain areas of the <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> such as particular <style="Link"><link="tiles">Tiles</link></style> while others, mainly those using <style="Link"><link="territories">Territories</link></style>, have each discernible gameplay space have its own <style="Link"><link="resources">Resource</link></style>. Placing <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> in <style="Link"><link="inaccessible-areas">Inaccessible Areas</link></style> can let players see these before they can access them and thereby help them set up goals; this assumes that players will later be able to get access to the areas. Being able to have <style="Link"><link="area-control">Area Control</link></style> over <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> limit who can make use of the <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> they contain and intensify <style="Link"><link="gain-ownership">Gain Ownership</link></style> goals.

The exact type of <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> placed naturally depends on what <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> are used in a game, but several patterns relate to how they can be placed in <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="game-items">Game Items</link></style> (including the more specific choices of <style="Link"><link="tools">Tools</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="vehicles">Vehicles</link></style>) and <style="Link"><link="pick-ups">Pick-Ups</link></style> are basic <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style>. <style="Link"><link="chargers">Chargers</link></style> provide a more abstract case since they affect <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> of the game elements that come into proximity of them. Stationary <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Resource%20Generators">Resource Generators</link></style> that can be harvested, i.e. provide some <style="Link"><link="controllers">Controller</link></style> functionality, are also <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style>. <style="Link"><link="bases">Bases</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="installations">Installations</link></style> often contain, produce, or manage <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> and thereby are <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> as well.

Besides the intentionality and <style="Link"><link="environmental-storytelling">Environmental Storytelling</link></style> shown by <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> in the form of <style="Link"><link="bases">Bases</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="installations">Installations</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="traces">Traces</link></style> of the <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> (or its collecting) found nearby <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> can also provide <style="Link"><link="environmental-storytelling">Environmental Storytelling</link></style>.

While how to represent the <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> found in <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> depend on their diegetic nature, the importance of <style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> can be stressed through using <style="Link"><link="diegetically-outstanding-features">Diegetically Outstanding Features</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Resource Locations</style> are <style="Link"><link="resource-sources">Resource Sources</link></style> and quite often <style="Link"><link="strategic-locations">Strategic Locations</link></style>. If where they exist are already known or public information, the knowledge (or suspicion) of their existence gives rise to <style="Link"><link="game-world-exploration">Game World Exploration</link></style>. Being able to access them provides a form of <style="Link"><link="gain-ownership">Gain Ownership</link></style> goal, especially if this is contests by other players. Making most efficient use of them can signify that gameplay is in <style="Link"><link="exploitation">Exploitation</link></style> phases.
